Description: Given the following medical report text, identify the sizes of up to 5 lesions mentioned in the report in millimeters. Use Roman numerals (I, II, III, IV, V) in the text to determine the order of the lesions. If a lesion is not present, output 0.0 for its size. Round the sizes to the nearest whole number.

reasoning.description: The thought process leading to the final answer.

lesion_1.description: The estimated size of the first RECIST target lesion in millimeters. If not described, set to 0.0.

lesion_2.description: The estimated size of the second RECIST target lesion in millimeters. If not described, set to 0.0.

lesion_3.description: The estimated size of the third RECIST target lesion in millimeters. If not described, set to 0.0.

lesion_4.description: The estimated size of the fourth RECIST target lesion in millimeters. If not described, set to 0.0.

lesion_5.description: The estimated size of the fifth RECIST target lesion in millimeters. If not described, set to 0.0.
